title: Semolina Cookies
introduction: Canestrelli, meaning 'little baskets,' are delightful Ligurian cookies characterized by their crisp buttery texture and delicate creamy color. The inclusion of semolina imparts a slightly gritty yet smooth texture, making these cookies a unique treat. Enjoyable with a cup of tea or coffee, these semolina cookies are a perfect example of Italian baking tradition.
ingredients: 1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, at room temperature
instructions: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, semolina, and salt.

In a large bowl with an electric mixer, beat the butter on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 2 minutes. Add the sugar and beat until well blended, about 1 minute more. Beat in the egg until blended.
Add the dry ingredients and stir on low speed until just blended. (Do not overmix.) Gather the dough into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 1 hour up to overnight.
Preheat the oven to 350Â°F. Grease 2 large baking sheets.

On a lightly floured surface, with a rolling pin, roll out the dough to a 9-inch circle about 1/4 inch thick. With a cookie or biscuit cutter, cut the dough into 2-inch circles. Place on the prepared baking sheets about 1 inch apart.
Have ready 2 wire cooling racks. Bake 13 minutes or until the cookies are lightly golden around the edge.

Transfer the baking sheets to the cooling racks. Let the cookies cool 5 minutes on the baking sheets, then transfer them to the wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container up to 2 weeks.
